preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Juan is a mentor in a big software company called INNOVADE. Luke is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Juan is a passionate and energetic mentor. Juan thrives on helping others and their enthusiasm is contagious. Juan always pushes their mentee to new heights, fostering a spirit of ambition and drive.
    Luke is shy and wants to improve their coding skills. Luke just graduated from college and Luke is eager to learn from their mentor. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Juan the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Juan and Luke. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Juan wants Luke to never set up CI/CD pipelines.

Generate a short conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. They talk about performance evaluation criteria, feedback mechanisms, and recognition programs.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about creating a culture of accountability and ownership to drive results and achieve goals. After that, Juan gives some specific coding instructions to Luke. Juan wants Luke to always include try statements in methods. Juan wants Luke to always end method names with '_md'. Juan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Juan never says 'for example'. Juan does not give any other coding instructions. Luke only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Juan wants Luke to use PyCharm as preferred IDE. Juan gives some specific coding instructions to Luke. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke: Juan now wants Luke to always end method names with '_o'. Juan wants Luke to always use docstrings in functions. Juan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Juan never says 'for example'. Juan does not give any other coding instructions. Luke only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Juan wants Luke to never use a linter. Juan gives some specific coding instructions to Luke. Juan wants Luke to always include assert statements in methods. Juan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Juan never says 'for example'. Juan does not give any other coding instructions. Luke only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke. Juan now wants Luke to use VSCode as preferred IDE.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. They talk about conducting team-building workshops and leadership training to develop future leaders.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke. Juan now wants Luke to always use a linter.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. Juan wants Luke to never use a notebook for taking notes. Juan gives some specific coding instructions to Luke. Juan wants Luke to always include the string 'chx' in function names. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke: Juan now wants Luke to always end method names with '_a'. Juan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Juan never says 'for example'. Juan does not give any other coding instructions. Luke only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke. Juan now wants Luke to always set up CI/CD pipelines. Juan gives some specific coding instructions to Luke. Juan wants Luke to always include try statements in functions. Juan wants Luke to always include a single digit in method names. Juan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Juan never says 'for example'. Juan does not give any other coding instructions. Luke only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 11 conversations before. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke. Juan now wants Luke to use Emacs as preferred IDE.

Generate a long conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 12 conversations before. Juan gives some specific coding instructions to Luke. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke: Juan now wants Luke to always end method names with '_x'. Juan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Juan never says 'for example'. Juan does not give any other coding instructions. Luke only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 13 conversations before. They talk about conducting team-building workshops and leadership training to develop future leaders. They had a previous conversation about this before.

Generate a short conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 14 conversations before. Juan is updating a previous information given to Luke. Juan now wants Luke to always use a notebook for taking notes.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Juan and Luke. This is not their first conversation. They had 15 conversations before. Juan gives some specific coding instructions to Luke. Juan wants Luke to always add the '@trace_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Juan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Juan never says 'for example'. Juan does not give any other coding instructions. Luke only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
